intro: Aspidostemon andohahelensis, commonly known as the Madagascar dandelion, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments. It features a basal rosette of leaves and produces yellow flowers that develop into fluffy seed heads. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
